page.title: 20LANHYDROCK CHURCH
page.content: Mr. M. Trinnick has been the church-warden of{Lanhydrock Church} since 1960. In 1884 the church was restored and today is in very good order. Between {five and six thousand {pounds}is donated in the visitors' box. This goes towards the upkeep of the church and helps restore other churches.{The National Trust}lookafter the grounds and heat the church. There is a service every Sunday morning with a congregation of aboout 25; for a Communion it is over 30. Except for 2 people all are local. They have an old fashioned Prayer Book service conducted by the Rev. Davis of Lostwithiel. Great difficulty is experienced in finding{priests}to man rural parishes. In 1984 parishoners raised Â£6,000 for a new{digital {computer organ}.
